website_summaries.verdict: This round fire bowl imitates the feel of a campfire ring, but it's safe to use during most fire bans.
pros: Certified fire pit is safe to use during most campfire bans.Includes durable weather-resistant cover, attached 10-foot hose with regulator, propane tank stabilizer ring, and decorative rock set.24-inch diameter
Chrome knob with rubber comfort grip
Steel construction with high-temperature powder coating
cons: For more heat, consider placing smaller blocks in the bottom of of the bowl
Laying larger rocks too close to the ring can obstruct the holes

customer_reviews.title: It's a great size, gives off great heat
customer_reviews.text: So far we are loving this fire pit! It's a great size, gives off great heat, and was perfect for what we needed. We bought pavers and built a fire pit around it leaving holes for the hose and control knob. It's perfect, would give 5 stars but I don't know how it will keep up. The covernit comes with is fine, but I wish there was an option for a metal lid or something
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camp hero
customer_reviews.text: I recently camped in Colorado which has a ban on anything ember producing. This definitely kept us warmer at night and will attract all the other campers within a 100 foot radius...which is great because they'll share their whiskey with you. I wouldn't go for the smaller version because we were huddled pretty close when it was in the upper 40s. A standard 20 lb tank of propane will likely give you around 12 hours of warmth at full strength. Within 10 minutes of opening the box, we had heat. In short, I had whiskey and have new friends thanks to the Outland Firebowl Mega 850.
customer_reviews.author: Oneironaut

customer_reviews.title: We love it! We celebrated New Years 2017 at my ...
customer_reviews.text: We love it! We celebrated New Years 2017 at my house and placed it on our deck. It gives a good amount of heat and all of our friends loved it. We followed the suggestions from other buyers regarding the placement of the stones, regulated the flow slowly when turning it on and had a back up gas tank. My husband who loves our wood burning fire pit was skeptical to switch to gas and had our wood burning one ready as back up, but he did not have to use it as this one worked great. We live in the SF Bay Area so our winters nights can be pretty cold and this firebowl kept us warm!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: LOVING my fire bowl! I surrounded the bowl with stone to look like a fire pit. I do need to remove and replace 2 stones when turning on and turning off the fire pit but that’s OK! I bought fire glass for a little fancy look. As others mentioned, I used aluminum window screening to cover the holes so that the fire glass does not fall through. I did read that the propane will turn the glass black unless you add propane air filter valve, or switch to natural gas. So far my glass has not turned black. The heat output is perfect. In the pics it is on medium heat. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer Stanczyk

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit - puts out a good size flame ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fire pit - puts out a good size flame (~12"-16" when set at high) and definitely is capable of warming up the area. I was surprised with how much larger this bowl is than the standard pit. Initially I wanted to keep this in our RV but due to it's larger than expected diameter, that's not going to work. But I still love this thing. Also, now that some campgrounds don't allow woodburning fires, this is a great alternative. With regards to propane usage, when consistently set at HIGH, it burns a 5 gal tank in ~7-8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Eberly

customer_reviews.title: The Best Firepit for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is awesome!!!! My husband and I take it camping and it is so easy to enjoy a fire without having to carry wood, smell like smoke or to worry about embers flying out somewhere. We have it on a 5 pound propane tank and onnour last trip we enjoyed 2 fires (1 about 1 hour and 2nd about 3 hours) and only used half of the tank. Another great thing is that a lot of camping sites do not allow fires but this is harmless! Portable enough to use in the back yard too. The picture I posted shows the firepit with a standard camping pit. The 24” size is what we got! Enjoy😊
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Marty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but gas won't last long
customer_reviews.text: I took this camping the other night. Fantastic quality, easy to use so nothing but positive remarks on that. Only complaint is your propane will be empty very quickly, I set this on medium and it only last 4 hours and that was on a full 20 lbs tank. My gas grill at home is big, I can have all 4 burners on medium and I can cook for 10 hours on 1 tank. If I could do all over again, I would have got the small one for camping because it probably makes the propane last longer.
customer_reviews.author: azhelton

customer_reviews.title: Have to return
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the 883 Firebowl making the rocks all black eventually it cleared up but the rocks are ruined must have been some residue from manufacturing. messaged back and forth the Outland customer service and got nowhere . Very sad to say we have to return it .looks years old after 1 20 pound propane tank .just hope you get a good one because they won’t help you ! They actually gave me instructions to adjust the gas valve lol yeah no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Spendy but worth the money! Our state has had a burn ban for months & months so we take this camping with us so we can still have a campfire. It's twice the diameter of the normal propane "fire pits" and the heat that it puts out is quite surprising. It's not as much heat as a wood fire but it works. It does use a bit of propane. We are usually able to get about 6 hours straight out of it (turned on high) It lasts much longer on the lower settings.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: I like it even though I am a wood fire guy. Too many fire restrictions these days where I live and camp so I tried this fire pit. We did smores on it and even though we didn't have the big natural heated rocks to pre-melt the graham crackers and chocolate we figured out a way to make it work. Pros: Easy to set up. Easy to use. Puts out decent heat. Well made, substantial, but not too heavy Comes with a nice long propane hose and a regulator Cover protects from wind and weather when not in use Cons: Haven't found any yet
customer_reviews.author: White Mountain customer

customer_reviews.title: No cover like the standard size
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive compared to the standard one. Our friends have the standard 19”, and we thought ‘oh, what’s 5 inches... get the bigger one’ — it’s huge! especially compared side by side... but, it’s great for bigger groups to sit around! Only downside to this one vs the standard: this one doesn’t have the hard top cover, and you can’t even get it as an optional accessory. Frustrating because the soft cover it comes with doesn’t make for easy transport. Only option is to purchase a fully enclosed soft bag, but that doesn’t ensure the rocks stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina H

customer_reviews.title: Uses a lot of propane.
customer_reviews.text: It does not have a push button lighter like some. I would guess it uses around 5 gals. of propane 20 hours when on high, which it needs to be. It does not radiate heat to the sides anything like as much as a decent wood fire, most of the heat goes straight up, but not enough to cause problems under an awning or carport. It works very much as I expected. We small rv camp about 45 nights, year round and this is great for the many places that no longer allow open/wood fires. Not very heavy, especially if you carry the coals separately. A good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Fred T

customer_reviews.title: It's big.
customer_reviews.text: It is the bigger of the two main sizes you see on Amazon. Came well-packed. Did the research and knew what I was getting. Found this deeply discounted. Puts out a lot of head and the lava rock included are enough. The rocks are susceptible to creating a lot of dust if they are bounced around a lot. LP hose is very long. I love that it comes with the heavy duty cover. If you are tired of lugging around firewood, this is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This is a superior product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built, easy to use product that does just what it says it will do. Pros: great construction; very good heat output; hose is a step up; fit and finish is very good. All weather cover is a step up from what is usually included; rocks provided are just right, and glow with the heat; variable output is just right. Cons: does use gas at a healthy rate, especially on high. You'll want to have a back up tank ready to go when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Danger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: This pit was insanely easy to assemble, it is super cute, and it throws off more heat that other propane fire pits/tables/etc i've experienced. I would like a bit more heat but I know the size of the pit does affect it. I would definitely purchase this pit again but wish the company offered it in a bigger size! It's perfect for 4-5 people but 6 is pushing it...especially if you are trying to distance from people when warming up. Totally recommend though!
customer_reviews.author: mish

customer_reviews.title: Love this little fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: We used it on a camping trip and it was perfect. It didn't give off the heat you'd expect from a big fire pit but it kept us warm and set the mood. It was pretty light weight and my husband had no problem packing or transporting it. We ran it three nights (@ 2-3 hrs each night) and lit it the last morning during breakfast (>1 hr) and it ran out of gas during that last breakfast run. It was perfect. I highly recommend it. It was really nice not having to haul fire wood. I think too we'll use it at home. Can't wait for all the fun memories we'll make around this fire pit!
customer_reviews.author: Jess from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Love this propane fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a camping trip recently and loved it! Used it with a Heat Warden deflector and had about 25 people around the fire warming up. BLM officer showed up to make sure it wasn’t a real fire and we were in the clear! Used it morning and night on low for three days and propane bottle still isn’t empty! One person I was on the trip with brought hers and she has been using it for about six years! Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amber M

customer_reviews.title: Best Camping Purchase Ever
customer_reviews.text: First I'd like to start off with this. There is no substitution for a REAL camp fire while camping. The smell, the crackling and the ambiance. That said, where I live we get burn bans at times during the summer and are not allowed to have wood campfires. That said, this is about as good as it gets without a wood campfire. It puts out a big enough flame that would let you easily cook or roast marshmallows, but I choose not to only because I want to keep it clean. Summary - Wood campfire best > Outland Firebowl 883 second best.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Firebowl!
customer_reviews.text: This thing's great! We bought this for those campsites that don't allow ooen fires. It puts off a good amount of heat and is easy to set up. It cools down fairly quickly which allows us to put a plastic lid that we purchased separately on it. Rubbermaid Commercial Products BRUTE Heavy-Duty Round Waste/Utility Lid for 44-Gallon Container
customer_reviews.author: phinner

customer_reviews.title: Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fire pit but it does not put out that much heat unless you are sitting right up on it. (which makes me nervous) I am so glad I did not buy the smaller pit. We used this during our spring break camping trip and it got down to around 40 degrees. Basically had to sit around the fire with a blanket as well to keep warm. Easy to use. We have a 20 lb tank and we used only about 1/4 of the propane. (Only running the fire pit for about an hour on 4 different times)
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Beta Reading and Review

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this firepit- it's my new favorite thing in the whole backyard. I was going to buy a fancy 'smokeless' wood one for $1200 and decided to give this guy a try instead and it's just fantastic. I was going to build a natural looking rock surround around it but honestly, it is a pretty simple design and not too offensive aesthetically. Even on the lowest setting it's more than warm enough for our balmy California evenings. The kids love it- new nightly family ritual.
customer_reviews.author: Willcoa

customer_reviews.title: Big Quality, little price!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and very affordable. Bought a second one as a gift for a family member. Addition of some rock wool gaslog ember material really improved the flame esthetic. I see another reviewer picked up a trash can lid for a cover. Great idea. No lighter, no biggie, just pick up a grill lighter for a couple bucks. Light, portable, very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Stormin'

customer_reviews.title: TAKE AMBIANCE ANYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews on these portable fire pits I ordered this brand but Model 863 a month ago and LOVED IT! It is so good and works so great I sold it to my buddy who wanted one and ordered the bigger 883 which I overlooked. Either model you won't be disappointed? The 883 is 3 inches wider and a tad taller and will weigh a little more but the quality is tops!
customer_reviews.author: Genos BBQ Catering

customer_reviews.title: I Bought Another One!
customer_reviews.text: So pleased, we bought another... realistic flame, great quality! No more smoke, kindling or hauling wood to go camping. Most campgrounds allow you to use these even during a fire ban. We put second one on our backyard patio. TIP! I bought a 24” Everbilt water heater pan from Home Depot to use as a cover. It fits like it was made for it!
customer_reviews.author: Metz

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit for the money
customer_reviews.text: We've seen the same fire pit at other people's RV site, but none are nearly as big as ours. We love natural wood-burning fire pits when we go camping, but of course, not all places let you burn wood. We've put this one in our 5th wheel for thos occasions and love it. We added some fake logs to radiate even more heat. This thing is awesome. We always have everyone hanging out at our campsite, so if you're not a people person or don't want people hanging around your campsite, then get a smaller fire pt and they will invite you to their site instead.
customer_reviews.author: GinoRP

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on arrival, low quality rocks.
customer_reviews.text: This is a review by Lindsay! Great for the money. It came with a pretty severe dent in the side, but I’m too lazy to return it. It is functional and it is fun. As long as you read all of the instructions there are no issues. The low stars are because of the low quality stones and the fact that it was damaged on arrival. The stones turn black very quickly and the dent in the side was a let down. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrious

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a camping trip to Oregon, all wood fires were banned due to forest fires burning in the state. It worked great, we had 7 to 9 adults sitting around it and we were all comfortably warm. We plan on using it at home on the covered patio this winter for a quick evening fire. Still will have a wood burning fire pit. I highly recommend this fire pit. NO it's not wood, but it works great and we are totally happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BYOI- Bring Your Own Igniter/Lighter
customer_reviews.text: This is not heavy at all even loaded with the lightweight lava rocks. It doesn’t have an onboard igniter so use your Bic stick lighter. It is attractive and flames are high and hot on the high setting. Hose is long for safety. Also comes with a metal ring that helps to support your propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: A Koch

customer_reviews.title: Great addition with many options
customer_reviews.text: Like another purchaser mentioned, this firebowl can be fit into many normally wood burning pits for a great upgrade that's much less expensive than buying a made-ready patio propane pit. But it's easily removed to take camping. Truly a win-win, dual purpose product. After reading reviews, I was a little concerned the flame height would be disappointing, but I'm more than happy with the 8" or so flames after arranging the lave rocks just right and letting it heat up for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Scotto

customer_reviews.title: Very warm. Very good quality. 9~12 inch high flames.
customer_reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoy this fire pit. The flames are about 9~12 inches high when on full. The heat is enough that your legs will be too hot if they are 3-feet away. I recommend that you buy and set some gardening blocks in a perimeter to rest your feet on. However, leave plenty of ventilation around the blocks. Propane is heavier than air and you don't want propane gas to accumulate into your block pit and turn into a bomb. We have seen and tried other fire pits. This isn't the best looking one, but it is probably the best quality, strongest, and warmest of them.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligentsia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use.  Instant Fire!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in September and couldn't use it until now because of the fires on the west coast. It was very easy to assemble, just add rocks from the plastic bags, hook up to a propane tank and light! We love having instant heat. No more buying firewood and spending 45 minutes to get a fire going good. I will get a grill top for this to cook up hotdogs when we have the grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: MeMaw2020

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good to sit outside and enjoy the warmth given off by this firepit without the smoke and when in a rush to just kickback and relax. Lava stones included are plenty and includes a bag of spares as well. Overall 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michigander

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: Great backyard or camping fire place. Provides a good amount of heat several feet from the fire pit. My family immediately broke it in by making S’mores! Happy with purchase and would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: steven m voelker

customer_reviews.title: Fire Pit at its finest
customer_reviews.text: When you go camping and you see the sign that says .... NO Open Camp Fires (unless using propane gas pits. Well Hello Outland Firebowl 883 Mega Outdoor Propane Gas Fire Pit... Major flame, if needed, and the envy of all whom look your way.... the cover is awesome as it contains all the lava rocks, hoses to a tight fit when traveling. it fits easily in my RV and no mess..... bring plenty of propane .......
customer_reviews.author: Bill Thomposn

customer_reviews.title: Missing item in package
customer_reviews.text: The firepit looks great. Not a lot of assembly required. However, it says that it includes a carry strap but it was not in the box anywhere. In my rating I would have given a higher rating under Maneuverability if the carry strap had been in the box and there was a way to contact the seller. We hooked up the fire pit and it does put off some nice heat. We will use this at RV parks and when we have "no burn" or fire restriction days.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: Picture was take within a half hour after opening the box, notice the flames. Works like I was hoping for, should be able to roast a hot dog or marshmallow with out any difficulty. Temperature in mid forties with strong wind. Sitting along side of the fire felt good. I bought the propane tank and box from Amazon also. My son already tried making a roasted sandwich with it.
customer_reviews.author: OB

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit is great! Have been very happy with how it heats up and provides a warm glow. I converted mine to natural gas, but didn’t use their unnecessary $70 kit. I unscrewed their propane combo regulator /hose, drilled the orifice out to a #29, and hooked up my hose for my natural gas quick connect. You’ll need a little mechanical ability to do this, but it’s not rocket science. Next I may add an igniter so I don’t need Matches.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Field

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not often, I feel I got my money’s worth, but this firebowl was well worth it! Easy to assemble right out of the box. Ordered the “correct” natural gas adapter, and now just fire it up and no worries with running out of gas. I have this under my patio, with no issues with it damaging the ceiling. Nice to be able to step outside and comfortably enjoy a cigar, next to this fire. Quality of materials seem to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Beat the fire ban!
customer_reviews.text: After planned camp outs and suddenly fire ban kills the whole camping fun I thought to invest in pit that can be used during these bans. The unit is very well made I purchased the carrying case to go with it, super easy assembly, the only complaint is that I wish the flame could be adjusted a bit larger as it doesn't quite throw the heat out you would like on a chilly evening sitting around the fire. Other than that we love it and the darkened campsites around use were envious!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Like this has fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: Look ed or a while for the right fire table for our back deck, exposed to the windy ocean. Hard to find the right BTUs to make it more than pretty, and oh boy is it hard to find one that’s a decent value. For about 1/10–1/24 the cost of others, this is doing the trick just fine for us. We simply move the outdoor coffee table, and this is pulled into its place, and will keep a crowd outside for a nice evening. Could easily be taken to a remote site/beach. Picture above is in great, the fire seems larger in reality, but it gives an idea of dimensions and proportion.
customer_reviews.author: William87

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Outland Cypress
customer_reviews.text: It's a well made product, but this is my second Outland fire bowl, one that I purchased for my parents. I have an Outland Cypress at my house that I am absolutely thrilled with and the burner design on that model puts off a much better flame pattern that is also taller and from what I can tell, more heat. Plus its lower to the ground, perfect for sitting around. I figured with the Mega, the bigger the better. This is not the case. My advice....save money and buy the Cypress. I wish I had....
customer_reviews.author: Ralph A.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Firepit
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your expectations, this firebowl is more for looks, ambiance and fun than for keeping warm on a chilly night. If you plan on hauling this around in a storage compartment of an rv be sure to measure carefully. It’s bigger than you think. And then there’s the propane tank. When combined with good friends, good wine and a good campsite, this makes for a fun evening! Until the propane runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Kokomo

customer_reviews.title: Love this fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: We are loving this fire pit so far. I think we were shorted a bag of the rocks, but what we had still appears to work well. In order to cover the fire ring with the rocks it leaves a lot of open space around the edges, and to spread them out evenly leaves the fire ring exposed. We chose to bunch up the rocks to make the fire look more realistic. But so far we are happy with this purchase. We did order a carrying case which did not come quick enough for us to use on our first trip, but I do think the case will make transporting easier.
customer_reviews.author: Killman

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a fire pit. Don't need a pool. Don't need a hottub. I use this on the roof of my condo. The bottom gets hot to the touch but it doesn't heat the roof/ground below it. I bought a heat resistant blanket to put below it but I didn't need it. It's not too heavy to lift and move around, even with the rocks in it. Love how long the hose is. I've had no issues with it. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M. Hennessey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alternative to wood burning fire
customer_reviews.text: Our family has enjoyed this propane fire pit all summer long! It is a safer alternative to burning wood during the summer season. We roast hot dogs and make s'mores with this. They cook perfectly! It is great to know that once you turn the propane off, the fire is gone and there are no embers. It stores fairly easily for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Marine-X

customer_reviews.title: Works great and excellent purchase for areas with fire restrictions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, lasts many hours with a 5 lb. tank, great ambience and excellent build quality. Used this for the first time camping in the desert. Unbeknownst to ke, I was camping next to a concert after which I found myself surrounded by new friends warming themselves by the fire. We ended the night at 4am, after firing up the fire bowl around 10pm and had fuel to spare for a second night. It doesn't radiate heat as much as a wood fire pit, especially below the bowl, but is noticeably warm around the periphery. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Djahani

customer_reviews.title: Turn to low when lighting...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product although I wish this had an ignition source instead of using a bbq lighter. Need to turn gas valve all the way to low before lighting otherwise, “WOOSH” big shot of flame!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: great for camping
customer_reviews.text: great for camping. no wood to buy or carry no smoke and no restriction for open fire safe comfortable fire/flame. just have to make sure some idiot does not try to make a bigger fire by adding logs or people throwing ( burnable) garbage on the coals . when your done for the evening turn off the gas let cool and store
customer_reviews.author: guanoeye

customer_reviews.title: Good fire pit, but can be noisy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent firepit, and can certainly put out some heat. However, the instructions are a little vague on preferred/recommended rock distribution, and it is easy to block off too many ports. This causes the flame to become too cold and produce soot. Also, the fire pit regulator seems to make a high-pitched whine when turned down to the lowest and highest settings. This can become very off-putting and distract from the atmosphere you want.
customer_reviews.author: The Dire Dwarf

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! It's tasteful, large, easy to maneuver, puts out a nice amount of heat and came with a nice cover. It's great and I'm very happy with it. Now I can socialize on my deck this winter (since I won't be going in friend's houses due to Covid-19) and I can also take it camping without worrying about starting a forest fire. The price is amazing! I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Corette

customer_reviews.title: Great for fire bans when camping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take camping with us. It’s a lot bigger then I expected but the cover that comes with it makes moving it easy. It gives off a good amount of heat and kept us warm in the morning. We used it to roast marshmallows but didn’t cook anything else on it since it’s not recommended. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Etienne

customer_reviews.title: Great fireplace and no mess!
customer_reviews.text: Glad we purchased. Easy to assemble, but it came with a lot of Styrofoam, so I wish I could return it so that the company could reuse it. Easy to light, but be careful. Singed eyebrows the first time! ha ha. Good for camping or at home. No burn day? No problem! It would be nice if I could get some fake logs for this instead of the lava rocks. Roast marshmallows on it fine!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Porter

customer_reviews.title: It may be convenient but not much fire or heat
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, I bought the 24” wanting a bigger fire. the reviews made it sound like something we could sit around and warm ourselves. It’s just a Bar B Que with an open flame. Instead of a grill. Even on high you have to hold your hands over it to warm them. If your used to a wood fire you will likely be disappointed, no radiant heat like with wood coals.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Doss

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Fire Pit: flames, heat output, materials and more!
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased! We have used ours regularly for a over a month and it's a terrific product. We followed the tips from other reviewers on how to balance amount of stones with the placement of stones and with the level of gas to find the flames and heat output that we enjoy the most. It's actually quite adaptable. The materials are heavy duty, quality materials. And the cover that is included fits snuggly, keeping out leaves and moisture even with the high winds that we get in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: niceberg

customer_reviews.title: RV Firepit
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is good the box it was shipped in was horrible. Apparently someone decided to drop the somewhat heavy box and crushed the lip of the unit. We are RVers and was planning on using it for an upcoming trip. The return and exchange sis not allow enough time for us to receive a replacement. The other part of the equation is that this particular product is out of stock and therefore we would have had to accept a different model. My research seemed to indicate that this was one of the best models available. Overall rating lowered to 4 stars because of the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I love it
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. Took it camping and used a lot. Ran several hours per day for 3 mornings and nights off of a 30 lb. propane tank and didn't even use it all. Puts out a lot of heat yet the sides stay cool. Very safe. Only downfall is the lack of an auto light feature. It needs to be manually lit.
customer_reviews.author: Red America News

customer_reviews.title: Portable, strong heat and lovely ambiance
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit has been a game-changer to allow us to entertain outdoors. It’s light weight (lava rocks !) and puts out substantial heat. Surprisingly it’s not too hot to move immediately after using. Love the waterproof cover (fits like a shower cap) that truly is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Crystalyn Brennan

customer_reviews.title: have a big question
customer_reviews.text: love the fire pit. no complaints on the product. my question is how I can buy one on amazon on nov. 6,2020 for 118.00 dollars and now on amazon on nov. 15,2020 wanted to purchase one for a gift and they are over 200.00 dollars. sure doesn't seem right. hope someone gets back to me with explanation.
customer_reviews.author: james alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat Output-Not Transport Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Great heat output and easy assembly. We purchased for camping when there are fire bans. The cover is just fabric and would have preferred a hard cover to keep it protected if it tips over while being transported. There are no handles which would make it easier to pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Cyndy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome propane fire pit
customer_reviews.text: I came across this by accident and it has turned out to be an awesome purchase. I didn’t want a wood fire pit so this has been a god send. Puts out a lot of heat and awesome to roast marshmallows. They give you extra lava rocks. It’s very light to carry as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time last weekend. Worked out really well, kept us warm past midnight. Plenty of fire rocks included to cover the ring and cover can stretch over the dial. The wide lip helps for moving the pit. Just wish the bowl was taller as the wind can dissipate heat rather quick.
customer_reviews.author: J Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great for covered patio!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a firepit for use on our covered patio. I looked into a conversion kit for a wood burning pit I already have, but for the price this made more sense. It is solidly built. There is very little setup required. It doesn't put out as much heat as a wood fire, but it gets warmer as the rocks heat up. It puts out a decent size flame, probably not quite what they show in the picture, but sufficient for why I bought it. I haven't used it for a really long continuous period of time, but I would guess a tank lasts me about 10 hours. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SuperDave

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Firebowl so we could have a campfire when we had a statewide fire ban this year. It's easy to set up, easy to light, and it throws enough heat to boil water. You can also adjust the flames according to how much heat you want. We like the smokeless fire so much we may never go back to wood fires!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Crider

customer_reviews.title: A most have!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!!! Amazing!!!!! I can’t say enough great things about this fire pit.... !!!! Easy to put together. Easy to use. No more sparks, smoke in your eyes, no need to add a mother log to the fire. Perfect for about any night. Keep the flame low for warmer nights or high for cooler nights!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor camping when there is a fire ban in place.
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased so that while we are camping we can still have a fire. Camping isn't that much fun at night when you don't have a fire to gather around. Because of drought weather condition fires have been banned in most places. So we solved our dilemma by getting this fire bowl and it certainly made our camping nights around the fire a success.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn DeHamer

customer_reviews.title: Great propane Fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Love this fire pit and so glad we got this larger one. Fire Ban in AZ and this fit the bill. Pretty and so much easier than a wood fire. We sit out around it more often than a wood fire. Granted a blazing wood fire is warmer but this is so much less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Nanci D

customer_reviews.title: Good fire bowl for a RV.
customer_reviews.text: I like this fire bowl for my RV. It works ok, assembly was only dropping the rocks in it and attaching the fuel hose, those are two thumbs up. Once I got it I thought it was overpriced for its quality, and that is the reason I did not score it any higher.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fire bowl, we take it RV'ing and use it inside screen room when it's raining outside. We still love a real fire when camping or in the yard if wood is not too expensive or easily available. This unit easy to use and travel with in carry bag. It's so nice to have a fire when you want and were you want since it stays cool underneath and cools down quickly to store it when going to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Steel231

customer_reviews.title: Propane is expensive
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. If money for fuel is not an issue than you'll be happy. 5 gallon propane tank which last cost me $23.00 burns for about 7-8 hours on the lowest setting. That's about the same as $10 worth of wood. So you may want to keep an extra tank as it's a pain to refill constantly compared to throwing another log on the fire. (i use it every FRI/SAT nights).
customer_reviews.author: James Corridon

customer_reviews.title: Great Firebowl!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Outland Fire Bowl 883 Mega and really love it! It works perfectly and looks really nice. It came with extra lava rocks and a ring for your propane tank to sit in for safety. We love that this one has these nice thick angled legs instead of just a ring bottom like so many others have. Although I miss the smell of the burning wood from our last fire pit, it's nice that you don't have to haul the wood, chop it and take away the ashes. Much more convenient and if you want to have an impromptu fire you are always ready!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit!
customer_reviews.text: This propane gas firepit fit what we wanted perfectly! I lights very easily and puts out a nice flame even on breezy days. We use it on our back patio which is covered, something you cannot do with a regular wood burning firepit. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DaveInCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fire pit needs built in ignition switch!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this propane fire pit EXCEPT the fact that it does not have a built in ignition device. Most modern BBQs come with an ignition switch of some sort and for as much as I paid, I expected it to be a given. If you buy this product, make sure you order the long BBQ lighters or long matches. It will save you burnt arm hair : ).
customer_reviews.author: sillydream

customer_reviews.title: If you want a heat source...
customer_reviews.text: If you want a heat source, this is not the item to get. Stick to wood. Otherwise, if you're looking for ambiance, a nice setting & not ending up smelling like a smokey fire, this is a very nice replacement for a wood fire pit. A couple of other plus features would be the ease of moving it around & if you're camping in an area that does not allow open fire pits, many times this can be a replacement. Definitely need to check if this is allowable in the campground you are visiting.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Rahn

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fire pit after much research last year, and chose this one because of the BTUs. It indeed does put out quite a bit of heat! We recently moved to a different state and hooked it back up, only to discover that it wasn't working properly. I reached out to customer service, and within 24 hours, I had an email with 2 possible fixes, each with detailed step-by-step instructions with pictures. Within minutes my fire pit was working as normal, and I was very pleased. The fire pit is a bit heavy when you move it with the lava rocks in it, but otherwise it's perfect for our needs. I will be purchasing another for our camper.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina H.

customer_reviews.title: Big and sturdy with decent heat output
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July to use for camping during no burn days in AZ. Heat output is okay and ran on high for 2.5 nights on a standard propane tank. Comes with plenty of rocks and would be great in our backyard but we strictly bought this for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph_AZ4eva

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This was our third try in buying a fire pit and finally got it right. I have asthma and my husband likes a real fire. With the charcoal looking lava rocks and a great fire we have a real looking fire without the smoke. We had a party and everyone loved it and could not believe the heat it put out.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: Guzzles gas
customer_reviews.text: Guzzles gas and as you can see, MOST of the heat goes straight up into the air above. It does radiate sideways a bit and that's nice, but altogether it's TERRIFICALLY wasteful. And it's not easy to carry with your trailer/motorhome.
customer_reviews.author: K.T. Portland

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for a real fire.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for camping in CO this summer since a fire ban was on against open fires. Changed the regulator on this one so that it made a bigger fire, and it worked great. In fact, we like it so well it will probably always go camping with us even when we can have a real fire as well. We also used the fire logs in it, which was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ozarks1

customer_reviews.title: Get it! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We love this ring! I have an allergy to smoke, but still love the campfire, this is the next best thing. It's a great size to still feel like a campfire. We even made s'mores on it. Many places will let you use these even with a burn-ban in place. Adds great ambiance without all the smoke and mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan & Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Pit
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Will definitely be handy when camping in California and open fires are not permitted. So happy with the purchase, big enough to sit around campfire style yet small enough for easy storage and transportation.
customer_reviews.author: Sha Shoe Gal

customer_reviews.title: Best Fire Pit Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent fire pit and so easy to maneuver and start. It puts out a warm fire and is big enough for several to sit around. We have used it often through the winter. We found a Rubbermaid lid on Anazon that fits perfectly over the cover provided for additional protection.
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit for the money but missing carry handle
customer_reviews.text: We love the fire pit and it isn't too heavy to lug around. It said it includes a cover and handle, but mine didn't come with a handle, so it is a big cumbersome when trying to move it. Other than that, it is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddiction

customer_reviews.title: Cozy warm patio ambiance.
customer_reviews.text: Both of these firebowls are exactly what I’d hoped they’d be. My patio is the only place I’ll have an occasional guest and these keep us nice and toasty while maintaining social distance. They are easy to move around when cool if I want to rearrange things. Both were east to assemble and ready to go in minutes. Both came with carry accessories so portability would be no problem for camping and would be great for that. No need to pack firewood anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L Baker

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gas fire pit. Puts off a good amount of heat. Size is bigger than expected at this price point. We have used it twice and loved how easy it is to setup. No smelly smoke to deal with or wood to chop. Just pop it up and enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my uncle as a gift earlier this summer, he just unboxed it and it’s dented! The box was not damaged so I don’t think happened in shipping. Too late to return it at this point. So disappointing:( I’ve ordered several others as gifts and those were fine, this is likely just bad luck.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M Richardson

customer_reviews.title: uses alot of propane
customer_reviews.text: I actually love the way the fire pit works, but it uses alot of propane. you'll go through $30 bucks worth in a day and thats using it sparingly. So yes you can sit around your back deck with friends and enjoy a fire for hours. But your going to go fill your tank again the next day.
customer_reviews.author: toni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this gas fire pit all the time! It is perfect if you want a fire but do not want to smell like smoke. We like it so much that we take it camping with us. Great for an instant fire or if you want a fire for a shorter time. (with wood, you have to wait till it all burns out) Cheaper than burning wood and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and connect to propane tank. Easy for four people to stay warm. Just love it as can visit with friends outside and safely during the current pandemic. No problem adjusting the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Hinterseer

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake and bought this terrible little fire pit. I live in California and this thing can’t even pump out enough heat to keep you warm in 50 degree winter weather here. I highly recommend getting another product. If you are in a semi enclosed area it works ok but out in the open you don’t feel a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect! Arizona always has fire restrictions so I picked this gem up. The kids still roasted marshmallows over it and the wife actually liked it better cause she didn't smell like smoke. 1 5gallon tank lasted all weekend and just a FYI rinse the lava rock off before you put it in,which I did cause it's very dusty out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: So far no complaints. We bought it for camping because of fire bans. We camp at 10,000 feet where it is normally between 40-50 degrees at night and we put this in a screen room with walls and stayed comfortable all evening
customer_reviews.author: Megen

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I realized!
customer_reviews.text: I know measurements were included but I'm goofy enough not to realize that I would have been happy with and 18" model. This one is a bit heavy and since we use it for camping, it can be difficult to transport. All in all it works great, puts out good of heat and does marshmallows w/o the smoke of a campfire. Don't get me wrong, I love a good campfire but with late summer fire restrictions in our area, this item is an excellent substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Baconman

customer_reviews.title: Out door firepit rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: Great outdoor fire pit. Works well, the flame is just right. Their being a low flame and high flame. It also puts off some nice heat during the spring evenings. The kids love it. That makes for a happy mom. Living in our fith wheel it’s nice to conveniently light up a fire and sit around. Rather then smelling like fire smoke. Don’t get me wrong I don’t mind a wood fire, just going to bed smelling it routinely I can go with out.
customer_reviews.author: Bugfreak74

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is great for camping. I put a grill rack over it and we do our outdoor cooking with this little propane fireplace..no more wet wood to ignite, no wood to buy, no ashes. Better than I thought. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Add a few stones around and voila!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprising amount of heat and high flame for a portable unit. And love the fact that we can put it into the shed to keep the weather off of it and make it last longer. We dressed it up with a ring of flat stone stacked about 18” high. Then all you see is the burning surface. When we’re done, put the firebowl back in the shed and lay a wooden cover over the stone ring.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit, good value, needs a hard cover
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this fire pit. It's easy to use and puts out a good amount of heat. The soft cover that it comes with, however, is insufficient. When it rains, the water pools in the center of the cover. I guess I'm going to have to make my own hard cover.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have camped for years, but just last year we bought a travel trailer. Last year we went on a long trip and was loaded down with wood for the fire... never again! We just used our new Firebowl.....and all I have to say is LOVE IT!!! It worked fab right out of the box! We have several trips planned for the summer...and it makes it sooo much easier, not to worry about getting wood. Not to mention, no more washing everything because of the fire smell. LOVE IT!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Everything we expected
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our deck. We have a huge wood out in our back yard but this is perfect for our deck. Sat out tonight in 54 degree weather with a light long sleeve shirt on and it was perfect with the gas on the lowest setting. What a GREAT addition to our small deck. I’m finally looking forward to many evenings on our deck.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great for cool evenings under the stars with a glass of wine.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Used it twice. Just the right size, very easy to use, clear instructions, adjustable flame, and the included cover is perfect for protecting from the weather. We put a metal can under the cover in the center of the rocks in order to raise the cover enough to keep water from pooling and we use elastic cords to keep the wind from blowing the cover away. We highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: teach68

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the best part is since it's low to the ground so it keeps your whole body warm including your legs vs only upper part like a fire pit table would. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

product_meta.description: Perfect for outdoor recreation, the Outland Firebowl Mega adds ambiance to any outdoor activity and offers the easy alternative to traditional labour intensive campfires. This certified fire pit is safe to use during most campfire bans, you can bring the warmth and experience of a cozy campfire with you anywhere outdoors. Our 58,000 BTU fire bowls are constructed from high quality steel with a protective powder coating and enamel finish for long lasting durability. Features of the Outland Firebowl Mega include stainless steel burner & fasteners, chrome knob with rubber comfort-grip, and a 1 year Manufacturer’s Limited Warranty on all products. In most instances burning a propane fire pit without CSA or UL certification during a burn ban is prohibited. The Outland Firebowl Mega uses a standard 20 lb (5 gallon) propane tank (not included) and burns clean and smokeless, giving off enough heat to enjoy with family and friends anywhere outdoors. NEW CSA approved Natural Gas Conversion Kit 780 and Outland Mega Carry Bag 761 now available separately!
